item.title: The Last Caretaker’s ‘Final Frontier’ Update Adds New Vehicle, Locations, and More
item.content:encoded:
The Last Caretaker is currently unfolding in early access and impressing gamers worldwide. It’s an ambitious, emotional game that presents players with the utmost freedom, sending them into a world devastated by rising oceans and tasking them with preserving the remnants of humanity, hundreds of years after they’ve left the planet.

Channel37, the game’s developer, has just unveiled the bulk of The Final Frontier, the game’s second major update since it was released in December 2025 in early access. It’s fairly accurate to say this update is huge.

New Ways to Sail, New Places to Sail To

The Final Frontier has just been released, marking the arrival of the second major expansion to The Last Caretaker. Despite the name, it’s just the beginning for this open-world sandbox, which we recently awarded a 9/10 in our full review.

The update starts with new ways to explore the game. Players are tasked with finding a new location, ‘Rocky Islands’, which leads to them unlocking the CS-17 Courier Skimmer, a Jet Ski-type craft. This is contained within a whole new biome that itself contains more quests to uncover.

Additionally, Channel37 has added ‘The Maze’, a tricky facility that’s not hard to find, but is hard to escape from once you’re lost within. That, too, contains more quest lines to discover.

The order of the day with The Final Frontier is deeper customization, and with that in mind, players can tweak their all-important vessel with 37 paint styles, all of which are free to find around the world. Additionally, new tools, such as the ‘deep ocean floor sonar’, have been added.

Channel37 has introduced a stack of quality-of-life improvements and adjustments with The Final Frontier, including:

  • Better building visualization and snapping
  • New dismantling visuals per material
  • Animation and usability improvements
  • Improved underwater visibility
  • More data logs to find
  • New achievements
  • Performance and stability upgrades across physics, rendering, buoyancy, cables, and UI

The Final Frontier is totally free to download and explore, and it represents the second in a very long line of updates planned for The Last Caretaker.

Are you interested in diving deeper into The Last Caretaker? Let us know your thoughts about this update on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news about Steam’s new feature for early access games

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: Pokémon EUIC 2026 Twitch Drops—All Pokémon Go, Pokémon Unite & More Rewards
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon EUIC kicks off this week, with players across several aspects looking to book their spot in August’s grand finals in California, and there’s a host of Twitch Drops to earn across the weekend.

Whether you’re a player of Pokémon Unite, Pokémon Go, Pokémon TCG Live, or even Pokémon Scarlet & Violet, rewards for those who tune in to watch streams are eligible for a host of exclusive rewards.

For a full breakdown of everything available, Insider Gaming has you covered.

All Pokémon Go EUIC 2026 Twitch Drop Rewards

Twitch Drops in Pokémon Go are awarded once at least 30 minutes of the EUIC Livestream, exclusively available through the Pokémon Go Twitch channel.

The reward is for a special Timed Research in Pokémon Go, which includes an encounter with a Dewgong that knows Icy Wind, inspired by NiteTimeClasher’s LAIC-winning team.

The Timed Research also includes these rewards:

  • 15x Seel Candy XL
  • 20x Fast TM
  • 20x Charged TM
  • 1x Elite Charged TM

The redemption will be available until February 28, 2026, at 3 PM PT.

All Pokémon Scarlet & Violet EUIC 2026 Twitch Drop Rewards

Celebrating the success of Yuma Kinugawa reaching the top of the Masters Division in the 2026 LAIC, Pokémon Scarlet & Violet players can add a Hisuain Typhlosion with the same moves and stats as Yuma’s own.

The Twitch Drop will be different to others, as it’s also available on YouTube and is redeemed by entering a password that will be revealed during the stream.

The key details of Kinugawa’s Hisuain Typhlosion are shown in the table below:

All Pokémon Unite EUIC 2026 Twitch Drop Rewards

Pokémon Unite players are also in for a treat during EUIC, with a cosmetic reward available alongside a platinum Charizard boost emblem that can be used to alter your Pokémon’s stats.

During the coverage, a password will be displayed that can be redeemed for an in-game sticker featuring the 2026 EUIC logo, and watching for at least 20 minutes on Twitch provides a code to redeem in the Pokémon Unite Gift Exchange for the Charizard boost item.

Both rewards can be redeemed until March 31, 2026, at 4:59 PM PT.

All Pokémon TCG Live EUIC 2026 Twitch Drop Rewards

TCG Live players can kickstart their Ascended Heroes collection during the event, with rewards distributed both as Twitch Drops as via a redeemable password.

Rewards include Ascended Heroes booster packs, deck cosmetics, and two Special Illustration Ascended Heroes cards, with the rewards available to redeem until March 17, 2026, at 12:59 AM PT.

A full list of all the TCG Live rewards and how to earn them is shown in the table below.

How to Get Pokémon Twitch Drop Rewards

While some of the rewards during Pokémon EUIC are not locked behind Twitch Drops, you need to have an account with both the Pokémon Trainer Central website and Twitch to claim all of the rewards.

Fortunately, it’s an easy process to do and is not at all complicated. To claim the rewards obtained via Twitch Drops, follow these steps.

  1. Go to the Pokémon Trainer Central website.
  2. Log in to your Pokémon Trainer Central account.
  3. Hit the button to connect your account with Twitch.
  4. Keep an eye on your Drop Inventory on Twitch for rewards.

Which of these Twitch Drops have caught your eye for the Pokémon EUIC? Share the codes you discover with other players in the Insider Gaming Discord.

Done reading? Now check out all of the LEGO Pokémon codes to redeem, and read about hints that Pokémon Fire Red and Leaf Green could return.
